scar

Class GetFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • scar.GetFile

  • public class GetFile
extends java.lang.Object
    GetFile contains the combined logic for Retrival of a file given the filename, key and set of servers associated with it An overview of the process can be seen:

        public int dint(byte[] data,
                int start)
        Decodes a 4-byte int from a byte array at an offset 'start'
        Parameters:
        data - input byte array
        start - offset
        Returns:
        4-byte int from the position data[start] to data[start+3]

      • clearFutures

        private void clearFutures(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.concurrent.Future<Chunk>> futures,
                          java.util.ArrayList<Chunk> lst,
                          byte[] key)
        Scans our download futures to see if any are finished, if so:
        1. remove its future
        2. get the chunk from the download associated with it and add to our list of chunks
        Parameters:
        futures - list of chunk futures waiting to complete download
        lst - list of known chunks

      • lookupMeta

        private int lookupMeta(ChunkMeta[] metas,
                       java.lang.String name)
        Maps a chunk name to its respective ChunkMeta
        Parameters:
        metas - list of known chunk metas
        name - chunk name we're searching for
        Returns:
        the index of the chunk with the given name if found, otherwise, -1

      • fetchChunks

        private void fetchChunks(java.util.ArrayList<Chunk> lst,
                         Chunk[] data,
                         ChunkMeta[] metas,
                         byte[] key)
        Fetches atleast 'k' chunks for decoding use later This is done via a thread pool and futures to know if a task has been completed yet or not
        Parameters:
        lst - list of known chunks in our system
        data - Currently known chunk data from hashchaining
        metas - all the known chunk metas
        key - key for HMAC for the chunks

      • distribute_chunks

        private Chunk[] distribute_chunks(byte[][] hc)
        Genererates the distribution of chunks given the hashchain Basic Algorithm:
        1. make a list of chunk ids
        2. pick from this list with removal via current hash in hashchain
        3. assign this chunk to the current virtual server
        4. increment to next virtual server modulo the maximum virtual servers
        Basically a round robin distribution of chunks given by the hashchain as far as what chunk goes to what server
        Parameters:
        hc - hashchain
        Returns:
        array of chunks with their server information set and indexing set

      • get

        public byte[] get(ChunkMeta[] cms)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        get contains the brains for getting a file from the servers back to its original form if possible The flow of this is as followed:
        1. Generate hashchain
        2. Generate chunk distribution via hashchain
        3. Fetch atleast k chunks
        4. If we have enough chunks, decode is via RS
        5. remove RS padding
        6. decrypt the data
        7. return the original data
        Parameters:
        cms - Known chunk metas
        Returns:
        original file data byte array if possible, otherwise, nul
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - on any major IO failure
